#summary The Contacts Example - Step 1

This sequence of tutorials assumes that you're using version 2.4 of the [https://developers.google.com/web-toolkit/download Google Web Toolkit] and the associated [https://developers.google.com/eclipse/ Eclipse plugin].

  * Import the dark-matter-data project into your workspace.<p/>The SVN URL is `https://dark-matter-data.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/`. <p>Note: the eclipse project is below the `dark-matter-data` folder beneath `trunk` and is also called `dark-matter-data`.<p/>Usually, you would just use the dark-matter JAR, but, since this is a tutorial, it is useful to have access to the full dark-matter code base.<p/>
  * Use the Google plugin mechanisms to create a new Web Application Project with name `contacts1` and package `com.example`<p/>
  * Right click the `contacts1` project and select `Build Path->Configure Build Path...`<p/>
  * Select the `Projects` tab. Click `Add...` <br>
   Select the `dark-matter-data` project and hit `Ok`<p/> This provides access to the dark-matter code base.<p/>
  * Select the `Libraries` tab. Click `Add JARs...`
   Expand the `dark-matter-data` project <br>
   Expand the `extjars` folder <br>
   Select the `gwteventservice-1.1.1.jar` and hit `Ok`<p/>The [http://code.google.com/p/gwteventservice/ GWTEventService] is used to allow the dark-matter to provide truly asynchronous messaging and event notification (thanks Sven!).<p/>
  * In your source tree, beneath `com.example.contacts` edit the `Contacts1.gwt.xml` file (in text mode) and replace its contents with: <p/>
{{{
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<module rename-to='contacts1'>
  <!-- Inherit the core Web Toolkit stuff.                        -->
  <inherits name='com.google.gwt.user.User'/>

  <!-- Inherit the default GWT style sheet.  You can change       -->
  <!-- the theme of your GWT application by uncommenting          -->
  <!-- any one of the following lines.                            -->
  <inherits name='com.google.gwt.user.theme.clean.Clean'/>
  <!-- <inherits name='com.google.gwt.user.theme.standard.Standard'/> -->
  <!-- <inherits name='com.google.gwt.user.theme.chrome.Chrome'/> -->
  <!-- <inherits name='com.google.gwt.user.theme.dark.Dark'/>     -->

  <!-- Other module inherits                                      -->

  <inherits name="de.novanic.eventservice.GWTEventService"/>
  
  <inherits name="org.dmd.darkmatterprotocol"/>

  <!-- Specify the app entry point class.                         -->
  <entry-point class='com.example.contacts.client.Contacts1'/>

  <!-- Specify the paths for translatable code                    -->
  <source path='client'/>
  <source path='shared'/>
  
  <!-- Turn off loggin for now -->
  <set-property name="gwt.logging.enabled" value="FALSE"/> 
  
</module>

}}}
  <p/>The salient points here are the addition of dependencies on the GWT Event Service and dark-matter (in the other module inherits section) and disabling of GWT Logging (which is inherited by the `darkmatterprotocol` module). <p/>
  * The next step is to add support for the services implied by the entries we added to the `Contacts1.gwt.xml` configuration.<p/>
  Beneath the `contacts1` project, open the `war` folder <br>
  Open the `WEB-INF` folder <br>
  Edit the `web.xml` file (in text mode)<p/>
  * Replace the `greetServlet` definition with the following servlet definitions:<p/>
{{{
  <!-- Servlets -->
  
  <!-- The GWT Event Service -->
  <servlet>
      <servlet-name>eventServiceImpl</servlet-name>
      <servlet-class>de.novanic.eventservice.service.EventServiceImpl</servlet-class>
  </servlet>
  <servlet-mapping>
      <servlet-name>eventServiceImpl</servlet-name>
      <url-pattern>/contacts1/gwteventservice</url-pattern>
  </servlet-mapping>

  <!-- The Dark Matter Protocol Service - Reference Implementation -->
  <servlet>
    <servlet-name>DMPServlet</servlet-name>
    <servlet-class>org.dmd.dmp.server.servlet.dmpservletri.DMPServiceImpl</servlet-class>
    <load-on-startup>1</load-on-startup>
  </servlet>
  
  <servlet-mapping>
    <servlet-name>DMPServlet</servlet-name>
    <url-pattern>/contacts1/DMP</url-pattern>
  </servlet-mapping>

  <!-- Default page to serve -->

}}}
<p/>
